text: will it only show for an app marketplace listed app?
What is the best place to ask questions about API integrations?
Hi <@U01V64R73K8>, we could chat here or you could post your question <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations|on this board>

Perfect! The question I have is when creating a deal I would like to populate the Analytics history. When I was creating contacts via the API it would always say API. Moved that over to a form submission and entered in hutk in the context which fixed that issue. How can I do something similar for the deal when creating from the API?
This is for the contact

So what I am hoping is that the analytic history of the deal would have that the same as the contact. Example on the deal the original source type = Email Marketing, Original source data 1 = car, original source data 2 = lower position
so, a question, how are you creating your deal?
Just the api
Leveraging the npm HubSpot package
okay, so you're looking to add the source properties, right?
Yeah but the values need to come from the Hutk
That information isn’t available in a readable format on the cookie
ow, okay, I see now, you should grab that from the contact
But a contact can have multiple deals
hmmm...
and there could be different campaigns
that
I just want to know what campaigns are bringing in leads and which ones are not
that''s the issue with the source
you only get it the first time and then it doesn't change
There is another campaign
so I'm guessing you could add some custom properties on the deal, and then associate it with the contact

Is anyone aware of any update to this issue. It looks like this <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Getting-deal-owner-phone-number-using-API/m-p/232763|thread> references v2. I'm curious if there is any way to surface more information about an owner in v3. I would like to retrieve whether or not a user is deactivated (which I recently learned is different from archived). I don't see a way to do that judging by the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners|current documentation>
so, add a property "custom_source", populate it when it happens and then associate with contact
Doesn’t it auto-populate somehow using the Hutk
how can I tap into the already existing tracking
Custom property is a solution but I don’t think that is really scalable
there is the tracking api, but I guess you can't tamper with how tracking actually applies any property, that
's just baked in
because we are creating campaigns in HubSpot and am assuming HubSpot would know that the deal came in because of a specific marketing push
have you created a tracking url for your campaign?
yeah I created a test one
Works flawlessly with the contact but the deal is another animal

yeah, well tbh I haven't messed a lot with deals, but it seems that things are getting complicated here, just talking for myself here, I think I would go about it either by using custom events and then incorporate it in a workflow, then in the workflow I would do some mambo jumbo to get the correct source and associate the deal with the contact
or get away with some custom property on a deal and associate it with the contact, no way to temper with the tracking code as far as I know

so here it is, the tracking api if you haven't looked it already, maybe you'll get something out of it.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code>
Yeah I am looking around to see if I can find anything

You can’t set that property directly, it gets set based on the original source of the contact - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Reporting-Analytics/How-does-a-deal-inherit-the-original-source-from-a-contact/m-p/401834/highlight/true#M2194|https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Reporting-Analytics/How-does-a-deal-inherit-the-original-source-from-a-contact/m-p/401834/highlight/true#M2194>
